appendicitis.name: Appendicitis
appendicitis.description: Inflammation of the appendix that typically requires emergency surgical removal.

irritable_bowel_syndrome.name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)

gallstones.name: Gallstones (Cholelithiasis)
gallstones.description: Hard deposits that form in the gallbladder, potentially blocking bile ducts and causing intense pain.
symptoms: sudden severe pain in upper right abdomen
pain radiating to back and right shoulder
gallstones.location: upper right abdomen, may radiate to back
gallstones.duration: episodic attacks lasting minutes to hours

peptic_ulcer.name: Peptic Ulcer Disease
peptic_ulcer.description: Open sores that develop on the inner lining of the stomach or upper portion of the small intestine.
symptoms: pain that may worsen between meals and at night
pain that temporarily improves after eating or taking antacids
peptic_ulcer.severity: mild to severe, can be life-threatening if bleeding occurs
peptic_ulcer.duration: chronic condition with periods of remission and flare-ups

food_poisoning.name: Food Poisoning (Foodborne Illness)
food_poisoning.description: Illness caused by consuming contaminated food or beverages containing harmful bacteria, viruses, or parasites.
food_poisoning.severity: mild to moderate, can be severe in vulnerable populations

kidney_stones.name: Kidney Stones (Nephrolithiasis)
kidney_stones.description: Hard deposits made of minerals and salts that form inside the kidneys and can cause severe pain when passing.

pain that radiates to lower abdomen and groin
pain that comes in waves and fluctuates in intensity
blood in urine (pink, red, or brown)

risk_factors: high protein, sodium, or sugar diet

conversation_templates.patient_input: I've been having burning stomach pain and nausea for the past few days
conversation_templates.assistant_response:
The combination of burning stomach pain and nausea over several days suggests possible gastritis (stomach lining inflammation) or peptic ulcer disease.

**Common causes include:**
‚Ä¢ H. pylori bacterial infection
‚Ä¢ NSAIDs (ibuprofen, aspirin) use
‚Ä¢ Stress or spicy foods
‚Ä¢ Excessive alcohol consumption

**Typical symptoms:**
‚Ä¢ Burning pain in upper abdomen
‚Ä¢ Nausea, especially on empty stomach
‚Ä¢ Pain that may improve temporarily after eating
‚Ä¢ Bloating and loss of appetite

**Recommendations:**
‚Ä¢ Avoid NSAIDs, alcohol, and spicy foods
‚Ä¢ Eat smaller, more frequent meals
‚Ä¢ Consider over-the-counter antacids for temporary relief
‚Ä¢ See a healthcare provider if symptoms persist beyond a few days

*Please consult a medical professional for proper diagnosis and treatment.*

conversation_templates.patient_input: I have cramping pain in my lower abdomen with bloating and gas
conversation_templates.assistant_response:
Your symptoms of cramping, bloating, and gas in the lower abdomen are commonly associated with digestive issues like Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) or dietary intolerances.

**Possible causes:**
‚Ä¢ IBS (functional bowel disorder)
‚Ä¢ Food intolerances (lactose, gluten)
‚Ä¢ Dietary triggers (high FODMAP foods)
‚Ä¢ Stress and anxiety
‚Ä¢ Changes in gut bacteria

**Management suggestions:**
‚Ä¢ Keep a food diary to identify triggers
‚Ä¢ Try eliminating common triggers (dairy, wheat, beans)
‚Ä¢ Increase fiber gradually
‚Ä¢ Manage stress through relaxation techniques
‚Ä¢ Stay hydrated and exercise regularly

**See a doctor if you experience:**
‚Ä¢ Severe pain
‚Ä¢ Blood in stool
‚Ä¢ Unexplained weight loss
‚Ä¢ Fever
‚Ä¢ Symptoms that significantly impact daily life

*This guidance is educational and doesn't replace professional medical consultation.*
